div.l: For symken wolde no wyfe As he sayde
But sche were well ynorysschede and A Mayde
To sauene his Estate And yemanrye
And sche was proude ⁊and perte As is a pye
A Fulle Fayer syghte hitt was of hem two
On halydayes aforne her wolde he go
With his typpette wounden Abowte his hede
And sche can after in A kyrtille of rede
And symken hadde hosen of the same
There durste no wyghte clepen her butte dame
Was none so hardye þat wente by þe waye
That durste with her rage oþ̉er ones playe
Butte yefe he wolde be slayne of symkyn
With panade with knyfe or with Bodkyn
For Iellouse Folke bene ꝑperlouse eủermore
Allgate þey wolde her wyues wenden so
And eke For sche was somdele smoterlyche
Sche was As deygne as watre in A dyche
As Fulle of hoker And of bismare
Her þoughte that A ladye schulde her spare
Whatte For her kyn̄rede ⁊and her nortesye
That sche hadde lernede in the Nonnerye
A doughter hadde they bitwyxe hem two
Of xxᵗⁱ yere withouten enye Mo
Sauenge A chylde þat was of halfe yere age
In cradle hitt laye And was a propre page
This wenche thycke And well growen was
With camoys nose ⁊and eyen graye As glasse
With buttockes brode ⁊and brestes Rounde ⁊and heyghe
Butte righte Fayer was her here I woll nought lye
The parson of the towne For sche was so Fayer
In purpose was to make her his heyer
Boþe of his Cattelle And of his Mesuage
And straunge he made hitt of her Mariage
